base_data.markdown_content:
Summary : This is an official emblem featuring a stylized circular design with a central elephant motif, surrounded by traditional patterns and symbols, likely representing a governmental or institutional seal. logo: Main Elements : • Central image of an elephant facing left, carrying ceremonial items on its back. • Elephant is enclosed within a circular border featuring repeating decorative motifs. • At the top of the emblem, a wheel-like symbol with eight spokes (possibly a Dharmachakra or similar icon) is present. • The base of the emblem includes two smaller circular symbols on either side and a pedestal-like structure in the center. • The entire design is monochrome (black and white line art). Dimensions & Placement : • The emblem is vertically oriented, with the wheel at the top, the elephant in the center, and the base elements at the bottom. • The circular border is the dominant shape, with all other elements arranged symmetrically within and around it. Analysis : • The use of the elephant, wheel, and traditional motifs suggests cultural, religious, or national significance, possibly from South or Southeast Asia. • The symmetrical and ornate design indicates formality and authority, typical of official seals or emblems. # ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ ගැසට් පත්‍රය ## අති විශේෂ # The Gazette of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka ## EXTRAORDINARY අංක 2289/43 - 2022 ජූලි මස 22 වැනි සිකුරාදා - 2022.07.22 No. 2289/43 - FRIDAY, JULY 22, 2022 (Published by Authority) PART I : SECTION (I) — GENERAL Government Notifications THE CONSTITUTION OF THE DEMOCRATIC SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF SRI LANKA ## Notifications WHEREAS I have in the exercise of powers vested in me in terms of sub-paragraph (a) of Paragraph (1) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, determined the number of Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministries and the assignment of subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions to the said Ministers; It is now hereby notified that the subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions in the charge of various Ministers shall be as set out in the schedule given below, from the date of this Notification. All such subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions that are not specifically assigned to any Minister will continue to remain in my charge as the President. RANIL WICKREMESINGHE, President. Presidential Secretariat Colombo 01 July 22, 2022 Summary : This is a QR code, a type of two-dimensional barcode, consisting of black and white square modules arranged in a square grid. It is designed to encode data such as a URL, text, or other information for quick scanning by digital devices. barcode: Type & Structure : • QR code (Quick Response code), square format. • Approximate module count: 25 × 25 modules. • Quiet zone: present (1–2 modules wide on all sides). Content : • Encoded data: [not human-readable from image alone]. • No visible numeric or alphanumeric string. Design Features : • Standard QR code finder patterns (three large squares) in top-left, top-right, and bottom-left corners. • Black modules on a white background. • No embedded logo, image, or colour variation. Analysis : • The QR code is machine-readable and likely encodes a short string such as a URL or identifier. • No visible branding or additional annotation; purely functional. 1A– G 37120 - 381 (07/2022) *This Gazette Extraordinary can be downloaded from* www.documents.gov.lk 2A I කොටස : (I) ව්ශේෂ - ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ අති විශේෂ ගැසට් පත්‍රය - 2022.07.22 PART I : SEC. chunks.text:
Summary : This is an official emblem featuring a stylized circular design with a central elephant motif, surrounded by traditional patterns and symbols, likely representing a governmental or institutional seal.

logo:  
Main Elements :  
  • Central image of an elephant facing left, carrying ceremonial items on its back.  
  • Elephant is enclosed within a circular border featuring repeating decorative motifs.  
  • At the top of the emblem, a wheel-like symbol with eight spokes (possibly a Dharmachakra or similar icon) is present.  
  • The base of the emblem includes two smaller circular symbols on either side and a pedestal-like structure in the center.  
  • The entire design is monochrome (black and white line art).

Dimensions & Placement :  
  • The emblem is vertically oriented, with the wheel at the top, the elephant in the center, and the base elements at the bottom.  
  • The circular border is the dominant shape, with all other elements arranged symmetrically within and around it.

Analysis :  
  • The use of the elephant, wheel, and traditional motifs suggests cultural, religious, or national significance, possibly from South or Southeast Asia.  
  • The symmetrical and ornate design indicates formality and authority, typical of official seals or emblems.

# ශ්‍රී ලංකා ප්‍රජාතාන්ත්‍රික සමාජවාදී ජනරජයේ ගැසට් පත්‍රය

## අති විශේෂ

# The Gazette of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka

## EXTRAORDINARY
(Published by Authority)
PART I : SECTION (I) — GENERAL
Government Notifications
THE CONSTITUTION OF THE DEMOCRATIC SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF SRI LANKA

## Notifications

WHEREAS I have in the exercise of powers vested in me in terms of sub-paragraph (a) of Paragraph (1) of Article 44 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, determined the number of Ministers of the Cabinet of Ministers and the Ministries and the assignment of subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions to the said Ministers;

It is now hereby notified that the subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions in the charge of various Ministers shall be as set out in the schedule given below, from the date of this Notification.

All such subjects and functions and Departments, Public Corporations and Statutory Institutions that are not specifically assigned to any Minister will continue to remain in my charge as the President.

RANIL WICKREMESINGHE,
President.

Presidential Secretariat  
Colombo 01  
July 22, 2022
